channel.title: Anthropic on AICube.FUN
channel.description: Recent content in Anthropic on AICube.FUN

item.title: Gain Control of Your Free Time
item.description: Speaker: Laura Vanderkam Summary: We don’t build the lives we want by saving time. We build the lives we want, and then time saves itself. Time is highly elastic - it stretches to accommodate what we choose to put into it. Instead of saying “I don’t have time”, say “It’s not a priority”.

item.title: The Intriguing Differences Between Extroverts and Introverts
item.description: In his TED talk, psychologist Brian Little discusses some fascinating differences between extroverts and introverts. He explores how our personality traits, especially extroversion vs introversion, affect various aspects of our lives. Key Points Extroverts need more external stimulation and tend to be more sociable.

item.title: Pivoting Startup Ideas
item.description: Many successful startups had to pivot and change their idea before finding product-market fit. Pivoting is common in the startup world - it means changing your startup idea because the current idea is not working. Y Combinator partners share stories of famous pivots:

item.title: The Promise and Peril of AI: A Conversation with Scale AI CEO Alexander Wang
item.description: Artificial intelligence (AI) has seen tremendous advances in recent years, with systems like ChatGPT demonstrating new capabilities in natural language processing. However, there are also growing concerns about the risks posed by advanced AI systems. I recently had the chance to speak with Alexander Wang, CEO of Scale AI, about the state of AI technology today.
